awd_titl_txt: A Computer Program to Teach Biological Simulation
awd_abstract_narration: This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project                  will develop computer software and a companion textbook to teach                modeling of biological problems using a simulation language that                is expressed in biological terms.  The thrust of the project is                 to incorporate pedagogical and electronic devices to promote                    critical thinking skills, thus rising above the drill and                       practice and tutorial software that comprises the existing                      market.  The open architecture of the software will permit                      students to challenge assumptions in models, to propose their own               hypotheses, and to test these hypotheses by developing their own                biological models.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
